intro: Hymenostegia normandii, commonly known as the Normandy hymenostegia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Hymenostegia normandii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
